OK. This info for all who doesnt know about 720p. Pls guys understand this.

All 720p has res 1280x720 and all 1080p has 1920x1080. All mean all ok, not some. :)
When movie has 1280x720 they have display aspect ratio(AR) 16:9 which is close ~1.81.
But some movies has AR 2.35 which is more wider screen, you have seen many 1280x544, 640x272, 720x304 they are ripping standard AR for 2.35. But as i told u earlier, movie makers release that wider screen movies also in AR of 16:9. 
How they do it, stretch it.... no :)  They add two blank bars to upper and lower part of screen. Do we need that black bars, no :).
Thats why there is a function call cropping comes with ripping. Rippers do crop (remove that black bars to save some Bytes) that and final version has AR 2.35. So, 1280x544 movie originally had 1280x720, So, this also 720p. 
PLs google about this to more info.
